name: Persian Mythology
rituals: Gathering: Fresh haoma twigs collected from sacred mountain locations
Purification: Both the plant and all implements undergo ritual cleansing
Prayers: Recitation of specific Avestan hymns (Yasna 9-11, the Hom Yasht)
Pounding: Twigs pounded in a stone mortar with a crescent-shaped pestle
Mixing: Combined with pure water and milk to create the sacred drink
Offering: First portion offered to the sacred fire
Consumption: Priests consume the blessed liquid sacramentally
Libation: Remaining portion poured as offering to waters and earth
Haoma as first priest, first warrior, first healer
Legendary figures who performed the haoma ceremony: Vivanghan, Yima, Thraetaona
Blessings granted to those who prepare haoma with devotion
Protection against demons and evil forces
Grants divine vision and prophetic insight
Connects worshipper directly with Ahura Mazda
